metadata.feature_description: Add, remove and manage tags for articles with tag-based filtering

steps.action: Navigated to Wiki Module page
steps.expected: Wiki page loads with article list
steps.actual: Wiki page loaded successfully showing article list

steps.action: Clicked 'Create Article' button to open article creation dialog
steps.expected: Article creation dialog opens with tags field
steps.actual: Dialog opened with title, content, and tags input fields

steps.action: Entered article title, content, and single tag 'single-test-tag'
steps.expected: Tag appears in the tags field
steps.actual: Single tag 'single-test-tag' entered successfully in tags input

steps.action: Clicked Publish button
steps.expected: Article publishes successfully with tag
steps.actual: Article published and visible in list with tag 'single-test-tag' displayed

steps.action: Opened Create Article dialog and entered title 'Multiple Tags Test - Jan 16 2026'
steps.expected: Dialog opens with empty form
steps.actual: Dialog opened successfully

steps.action: Entered content and multiple tags: tag-alpha, tag-beta, tag-gamma (comma-separated)
steps.expected: All three tags are accepted
steps.actual: Tags entered successfully as comma-separated values

steps.action: Clicked Publish button
steps.expected: Article publishes with all three tags
steps.actual: Article published successfully with all three tags visible

steps.action: Verified tags display on article
steps.expected: All three tags visible on article
steps.actual: Tags tag-alpha, tag-beta, tag-gamma all displayed on the published article

steps.action: Clicked edit button on article with multiple tags
steps.expected: Edit dialog opens showing existing tags
steps.actual: Edit dialog opened with tag-alpha, tag-beta, tag-gamma visible in tags field

steps.action: Removed tag-beta from the tags field
steps.expected: Tag is removed from input
steps.actual: tag-beta removed, leaving tag-alpha and tag-gamma

steps.action: Clicked Publish to save changes
steps.expected: Article saves with only two tags
steps.actual: Article published successfully with tag-beta removed

steps.action: Verified article now shows only tag-alpha and tag-gamma
steps.expected: Only two tags displayed on article
steps.actual: Article displays only tag-alpha and tag-gamma, confirming tag-beta was successfully removed

steps.action: Clicked on tag-alpha link on an article
steps.expected: Page filters to show only articles with that tag
steps.actual: URL changed to include ?tags=tag-alpha and page began filtering

steps.action: Verified filtered results
steps.expected: Only articles with tag-alpha are displayed
steps.actual: Article list filtered to show 1 article with tag-alpha tag

steps.action: Located tag filter input in sidebar and typed partial tag text 'meta'
steps.expected: Autocomplete dropdown appears with matching tags
steps.actual: No autocomplete dropdown appeared despite typing partial tag text

steps.action: Opened article editor and typed 'mark' in tags field
steps.expected: Autocomplete suggestions appear for existing tags starting with 'mark'
steps.actual: No autocomplete dropdown appeared in the article editor tags field either

issues: Tag auto-complete feature does not appear to be implemented or is not functioning. No autocomplete suggestions appeared when typing partial tag text in either the filter field or the article editor tags field.

steps.action: Created new article with special character tags: test@special, tag#hash, exclaim!tag
steps.expected: Tags with special characters are accepted
steps.actual: Tags were entered in the input field

steps.action: Clicked Publish button
steps.expected: Article publishes successfully with special character tags
steps.actual: 406 Not Acceptable error returned from server when attempting to publish article with special character tags

issues: Special characters in tags (@, #, !) cause 406 Not Acceptable server error when publishing. Tags with these characters cannot be saved.

steps.action: Observed tag cloud in sidebar showing CASETESTTAG with count
steps.expected: Tag cloud displays tags
steps.actual: Tag cloud visible showing CASETESTTAG and other tags with article counts

steps.action: Clicked on CASETESTTAG to filter articles
steps.expected: Filter shows articles regardless of tag case
steps.actual: Filter returned 2 articles - one with lowercase 'casetesttag' and one with uppercase 'CASETESTTAG', proving tags are stored and filtered case-insensitively

steps.action: Located tag cloud in Wiki sidebar
steps.expected: Tag cloud displays all tags with counts
steps.actual: Tag cloud visible in sidebar showing multiple tags including CASETESTTAG, tag-alpha, tag-gamma with associated article counts

steps.action: Verified tag cloud shows clickable tags
steps.expected: Tags are clickable for filtering
steps.actual: Tags in cloud are clickable and successfully filter articles when clicked

observations: Tag auto-complete functionality appears to not be implemented in the current UI. The tags input field accepts comma-separated text but does not provide suggestions for existing tags.

Special characters (@, #, !) in tags cause server-side validation errors (406 Not Acceptable). However, existing articles in the system do have tags with special characters (test@special, tag#hash), suggesting there may be inconsistent validation or these were created through a different method.
Tags are stored and filtered case-insensitively - searching for 'CASETESTTAG' returns articles tagged with both uppercase and lowercase versions.
The tag input uses a placeholder text 'Enter tags separated by a comma' indicating comma-separated input is the expected format.
